Attempting to achieve herd immunity while simultaneously mitigating the impact of COVID-19 on hospital burden is an extremely challenging task. In order to ensure the hospital burden does not exceed levels comparable with that of the United Kingdom in April 2020,

Due to the fine margins (in terms of control effectiveness) between successful disease suppression and overwhelming hospitals, making herd immunity the primary objective (rather than applying maximal social distancing and aiming for suppression) is not supported by our modeling. Put another way, mitigation (via “flattening the curve”) is not a practical objective: If mitigation efforts are sufficient to prevent hospitals from being overwhelmed, only a comparatively small further increase in control measures will drive
